stories.text: As an app developer, I want to include the code of a dataset type in my app artifact and create a dataset of that type when deploying the app.
actions: Include The Code Of A Dataset Type In App
Create A Dataset Of That Type When Deploying The App

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to deploy a new version of a dataset type as part of deploying a new version of the app that includes it and I expect that all dataset instances of that type that were created as part of the app deployment start using the new code.
actions: Deploy A New Version Of A Dataset Type As Part Deploying A New Version Of The App Includes

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to deploy a new version of a dataset type as part of an app artifact, without affecting other datasets of this type.
actions: Deploy A New Version Of A Dataset Type As Part Of An App Artifact Affecting Other Datasets Of This Type

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to explore a dataset instance of a type that was deployed as part of an app.
actions: Explore A Dataset Instance Of A Type Deployed As Part Of An App

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to ensure that when I deploy an artifact without creating an app this will not create any dataset types or instances.
actions: Ensure
Deploy An Artifact Creating An App Not Create Any Dataset Types
Deploy An Artifact Creating An App Not Create Instance

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to share a dataset type across multiple applications that include the dataset type's code in their artifacts.
actions: Share A Dataset Type Across Multiple Applications Include The Dataset Type's Code In Artifacts

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to ensure that when I deploy a new version of an app that includes a shared dataset type that all dataset instances created by this app start using the new code but all dataset instances created by other apps remain unchanged.
actions: Deploy A New Version Of An App Includes A Shared Dataset Type All Dataset Instances This App Start All Dataset Instances Other Apps Unchanged
Using The New Code
Ensure That

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to ensure that when I deploy a new version of an app that includes an older version of a dataset type deployed by another app and I expect that the dataset instances created by this app use the dataset type code included in this app.
actions: Deploy A New Version Of An App Includes An Older Version Of A Dataset Type Another App
Expect
Ensure That

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to ensure that when I deploy a new version of an app that includes a different version of a dataset type deployed by another app and this app shares a dataset instance of this type with the other app the deployment will fail with a version conflict error.
actions: Ensure
Deploy A New Version Of An App Includes A Different Version Of A Dataset Type Another App Shares A Dataset Instance Of This Type With The Other App The Deployment Fail With A Version Conflict Error
Deploy A New Version Of An App Includes A Different Version Of A Type This App Shares

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to share a dataset type that I had previously deployed as part of an app.
actions: That Deployed As Part Of An App
Share A Dataset Type

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to deploy a dataset type independent from any app and allow apps to create and use dataset instances of that type.
actions: Deploy A Independent Dataset Type From Any App
Allow
Create Dataset Instances Of That Type
Use Dataset Instances Of That Type

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to have the option of forcing applications to have the dataset code injected at runtime.
actions: Have
Have The Option Forcing Applications The Dataset Code Injected At Runtime

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to have an archetype that helps me package my dataset type properly.
actions: Have An Archetype Helps Properly Package Dataset Type

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to separate the interface from the implementation of a dataset type.
actions: Separate The Interface From The Implementation Of A Dataset Type

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to only depend on the interface of a dataset type in my app and have the system inject the implementation at runtime.
actions: Depend On The Interface Of A Dataset Type In App
Have

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to write unit tests for an app that depends on the interface of a dataset type.
actions: Write Unit Tests For An App Depends On The Interface Of A Dataset Type

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to assign explicit versions to the code of a dataset type.
actions: Assign Explicit Versions To The Code Of A Dataset Type

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to deploy a new version of a dataset type without affecting the dataset instances of that type.
actions: Deploy A New Version Of A Dataset Type Affecting The Dataset Instances Of That Type

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to create a dataset instance with a specific version of a dataset type.
actions: Create A Dataset Instance With A Specific Version Of A Dataset Type

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to explore a dataset instance created from a dataset type that was deployed by itself.
actions: Explore A Dataset Instance From A Type A Dataset Type Deployed

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to delete outdated versions of a dataset type and I expect this to fail if there are any dataset instances with that version of the type.
actions: Delete Outdated Versions Of A Dataset Type
Fail

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to list all dataset instances that use a dataset type or a specific version of a type.
actions: List All Instances Use A Specific Version Of A Type
List All Dataset Instances Use A Dataset Type

stories.text: As a data scientist, I want to be able to create a dataset instance of an existing dataset type without writing code.
actions: Create A Dataset Instance Of An Existing Dataset Type Writing Code

stories.text: As a data scientist, I want to be able to upgrade a dataset instance to a new version of its code.
actions: Upgrade A Dataset Instance To A New Version Of Code

stories.text: As a hydrator user, I want to create a pipeline that reads or writes an existing dataset instance.
actions: Create A Pipeline
Write An Existing Dataset Instance
Create A Pipeline Reads

stories.text: As a hydrator user, I want to create a pipeline that reads or writes a new dataset instance and I want to create that dataset instance as part of pipeline creation.
actions: Write A New Dataset Instance

Create A Pipeline

stories.text: As a hydrator user, I want to specify an explicit version of the dataset types of the dataset instances created by my pipeline and I expect pipeline creation to fail if that results in incompatible upgrade of an existing dataset instance that is shared with other apps or pipelines.
actions: Fail
Specify An Explicit Version Of The Dataset Types Of The Dataset Instances Pipeline

stories.text: As a hydrator user, I want to explore the datasets created by my pipeline.
actions: Explore The Datasets Pipeline

stories.text: As a hydrator user, I want to ensure that all dataset instances created by apps are available as sinks and sources for pipelines.
actions: Ensure All Dataset Instances Apps Available As Sinks For Pipelines
Ensure All Instances Apps Available As Source

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to ensure that all dataset instances created by Hydrator pipelines are accessible to the app.
actions: Ensure All Dataset Instances Hydrator Pipelines Accessible To The App

stories.text: As a plugin developer, I want to include the code for a dataset type in the plugin artifact, so that when a pipeline using this plugin is created a dataset instance of that type is created and it is explorable and available to apps.
actions: Include The Code For A Dataset Type In The Plugin Artifact

stories.text: As a plugin developer, I want to use a custom dataset type that was deployed independently or as part of an app inside the plugin.
actions: Use A Custom Dataset Type Independently Deployed As Part Of An App Inside The Plugin

stories.text: As a plugin developer, I want to upgrade the code of a dataset type used by a dataset instance created by that plugin when I deploy a new version of the plugin and update the pipeline to use that version.
actions: Upgrade The Code Of A Dataset Type
Use That Version
Update The Pipeline
A Dataset Instance That Plugin Deploy A New Version Of The Plugin
Upgrade The Code Of A Type

stories.text: As a pipeline developer, I want to upgrade a dataset instance to a newer version of the code after the pipeline was created.
actions: Upgrade A Dataset Instance To A Newer Version Of The Code

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to have the option of implementing an upgrade step for when a dataset instance is upgraded to a new version of the dataset type.
actions: Have The Option Implementing An Upgrade Step A Dataset Instance When Upgraded To A New Version Of The Dataset Type

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to have a way to reject an upgrade of a dataset instance to a newer version of it type if the upgrade is not compatible.
actions: Reject An Upgrade Of A Dataset Instance To A Newer Version Of
Have A Way

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to have the option of implementing a migration procedure that can be run after an upgrade of a dataset instance to a new version of it type.
actions: Have The Option Implementing A Migration Procedure Run After An Upgrade Of A Dataset Instance To A New Version Of

stories.text: As a developer, I want to take a dataset offline, so that I can perform a long-running maintenance or migration procedure.
actions: Take A Dataset Offline

stories.text: As a dataset developer, I want to implement custom administrative operations such as "compaction" or "rebalance" that are no common to all dataset types.
actions: Implement Administrative, Custom Operations Such As Rebalance
Implement Administrative, Custom Operations Such As Compaction Are No Common To All Dataset Types

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to perform custom administrative operations on dataset instances from my app and the CLI and REST or the UI.
actions: Perform Administrative, Custom Operations On Instances From Rest
Perform Administrative, Custom Operations On Dataset Instances From App
Perform Administrative, Custom Operations On Instances From The Cli

stories.text: As a user, I want to find out what properties are supported by the dataset type what values are allowed and what the defaults are when creating a dataset instance.
actions: Find Out
What The Defaults Be When Creating A Dataset Instance

stories.text: As a user, I want to specify the schema of a dataset in a uniform way across all dataset types.
actions: Specify The Schema Of A Dataset In A Uniform Way Across All Dataset Types

stories.text: As a user, I want to specify schema as a JSON string.
actions: Specify Schema As A Json String

stories.text: As a user, I want to specify schema as a SQL schema string.
actions: Specify Schema As A Sql Schema String

stories.text: As a user, I want to configure time-to-live in a uniform way across all dataset types.
actions: Live
Configure Time In A Uniform Way Across All Dataset Types

stories.text: As a user, I want to see the properties that were used to configure a dataset instance.
actions: Configure A Dataset Instance
See The Properties Used

stories.text: As a user, I want to find out what properties of a dataset can be updated.
actions: Find Out

stories.text: As a user, I want to update the properties of a dataset instance and I expect this to fail if the new properties are not compatible with a meaningful error message.
actions: Update The Properties Of A Dataset Instance

stories.text: As a user, I want to update a single property of a dataset instance without knowing all other properties.
actions: Update A Single Property Of A Dataset Instance Knowing All Other Properties

stories.text: As a user, I want to remove a single property of a dataset instance without knowing all other properties.
actions: Remove A Single Property Of A Dataset Instance Knowing All Other Properties

stories.text: As a user, I want to trigger a migration process for a dataset if updating its properties requires that.
actions: Trigger A Migration Process For A Dataset

stories.text: As a user, I want to ensure that if reconfiguration of a dataset fails then no changes have taken effect, so that all steps required to reconfigure a dataset must be done as a single atomic action.
actions: Ensure

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to ensure that application redeployment fails if any of its datasets cannot be reconfigured.
actions: Ensure

stories.text: As an app developer, I want to tolerate existing datasets if their properties are different but compatible when creating a dataset as part of app deployment.
actions: Tolerate Existing Datasets

stories.text: As a pipeline designer, I want to get a meaningful error message when pipeline creation fails when I use an existing dataset as a sink or source, so that I know that the schema or any other property of the dataset is incompatible with what the pipeline requires.
actions: Get A Meaningful Error Message

stories.text: As a user, I want to specify as part of dataset configuration whether it is explorable.
actions: Specify As Part Of Dataset Configuration Explorable

stories.text: As a user, I want to specify the explore schema separately.
actions: Specify The Explore Schema

stories.text: As a user, I want to ensure that an update of explore never leads to silent loss of data or data available for explore.
actions: Never Leads To Available, Silent Loss Of Data For Explore
Never Leads To Silent Loss Of Datum
Ensure

actions: Enable Explore For A Dataset Not Initially Configured For Explore
